name: Myr Prototype
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a +1/+1 counter on Myr Prototype.
Myr Prototype can't attack or block unless you pay {1} for each +1/+1 counter on it.

name: Myr Quadropod
text: {3}: Switch Myr Quadropod's power and toughness until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Each myr was designed to fill a specific role. This one, for example, was designed to stomp on other myr.

name: Myr Reservoir
text:
{T}: Add {C}{C} to your mana pool. Spend this mana only to cast Myr spells or activate abilities of Myr.
{3}, {T}: Return target Myr card from your graveyard to your hand.

editions.flavor: A mana well as bottomless as the myr are tireless.

name: Myr Retriever
text: When Myr Retriever dies, return another target artifact card from your graveyard to your hand.

editions.flavor: Mephidross gives up treasure easily . . . as long as you take its place.
Mephidross gives up treasure easily . . . as long as you take its place.
Mephidross gives up treasure easily . . . as long as you take its place.
Mephidross gives up treasure easily . . . as long as you take its place.

name: Myr Servitor
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if Myr Servitor is on the battlefield, each player returns all cards named Myr Servitor from his or her graveyard to the battlefield.

editions.flavor: The Krark Clan enjoys pulling them apart just to watch them reassemble one another.

name: Myr Sire
text: When Myr Sire dies, create a 1/1 colorless Myr artifact creature token.

editions.flavor: For the Phyrexians, death is not an end, nor a one-time occurrence.
For the Phyrexians, death is not an end, nor a one-time occurrence.

name: Myrsmith
text: Whenever you cast an artifact spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, create a 1/1 colorless Myr artifact creature token.

editions.flavor: The Auriok see the artificer as a conduit, beckoning new creations into the world.
The Auriok see the artificer as a conduit, beckoning new creations into the world.

name: Myr Superion
text: Spend only mana produced by creatures to cast Myr Superion.

editions.flavor: Two kinds of myr survive: the powerful and those that stay close by them.

name: Myr Turbine
text:
{T}: Create a 1/1 colorless Myr artifact creature token.
{T}, Tap five untapped Myr you control: Search your library for a Myr creature card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library.

name: Myr Welder
text:
Imprint — {T}: Exile target artifact card from a graveyard.
Myr Welder has all activated abilities of all cards exiled with it.

editions.flavor: Memnarch designed some myr to follow the levelers and reaffix lost parts. Mirran partisans put that instinct to good use.

name: Mysteries of the Deep
text:
Draw two cards.
Landfall — If you had a land enter the battlefield under your control this turn, draw three cards instead.

editions.flavor:
"The Roil is destructive, but not random. It's Zendikar's way of revealing secrets."
—Ilori, merfolk falconer

name: Mystical Teachings
text:
Search your library for an instant card or a card with flash, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
Flashback {5}{B} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

name: Mystical Tutor
text: Search your library for an instant or sorcery card and reveal that card. Shuffle your library, then put the card on top of it.

editions.flavor:
"To the tutors, a ‘poem of sand' was of little account, a ‘poem of ivory,' priceless."
—Afari, Tales
The student searches the world for meaning. The master finds worlds of meaning in the search.
The student searches the world for meaning. The master finds worlds of meaning in the search.

"To the tutors, a ‘poem of sand' was of little account, a ‘poem of ivory,' priceless."
—Afari, Tales

name: Mystic Barrier
text:
When Mystic Barrier enters the battlefield or at the beginning of your upkeep, choose left or right.
Each player may attack only the opponent seated nearest him or her in the last chosen direction and planeswalkers controlled by that player.

name: Mystic Compass
text: {1}, {T}: Target land becomes the basic land type of your choice until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"And I say north is where I want it to be!"
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

name: Mystic Confluence
text:
Choose three. You may choose the same mode more than once.
• Counter target spell unless its controller pays {3}.
• Return target creature to its owner's hand.
• Draw a card.

name: Mystic Crusader
text:
Protection from black and from red
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Mystic Crusader gets +1/+1 and has flying.

name: Mystic Decree
text: All creatures lose flying and islandwalk.

editions.flavor:
"Curse Reveka, and curse her coddled conjurers. Their sorcerers' school shall yet be ours."
—Irini Sengir

"Curse Reveka, and curse her coddled conjurers. Their sorcerers' school shall yet be ours."
—Irini Sengir

name: Mystic Denial
text: Counter target creature or sorcery spell.

text:
Protection from black
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Mystic Enforcer gets +3/+3 and has flying.

text:
Flying
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Mystic Familiar gets +1/+1 and has protection from black.

editions.flavor: They soar, and the mystics follow.

name: Mystic Gate
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{W/U}, {T}: Add {W}{W}, {W}{U}, or {U}{U} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: The gate of every kithkin doun is a cunning trap, intended to spill visitors into an oubliette from which there is no escape.

name: Mystic Genesis
text: Counter target spell. Create an X/X green Ooze creature token, where X is that spell's converted mana cost.

editions.flavor:
"The Simic can grow anything out of a puddle of sludge. I just hope they never join forces with the Golgari."
—Teysa Karlov, Grand Envoy of Orzhov

name: Mystic Meditation
text: Draw three cards. Then discard two cards unless you discard a creature card.

editions.flavor:
"Still the mind and quiet the heart. Only then will you hear the Multiverse's great truths."
—Narset

name: Mystic Melting
text:
Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

editions.flavor: The sun-hot glow radiated from the druids, leaving scattered metal in steaming pools as it passed.

name: Mystic Might
text:
Enchant land you control
Cumulative upkeep {1}{U} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
Enchanted land has "{T}: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn."

name: Mystic Monastery
text:
Mystic Monastery enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {U}, {R}, or {W} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: When asked how many paths reach enlightenment, the monk kicked a heap of sand. "Count," he smiled, "and then find more grains."
When asked how many paths reach enlightenment, the monk kicked a heap of sand. "Count," he smiled, "and then find more grains."

editions.flavor: "There are no obstacles, only different paths."

Vigilance

text:
Buyback {2} (You may pay an additional {2} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Scry 3. (Look at the top three cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

name: Mystic Veil
text:
You may cast Mystic Veil as though it had flash. If you cast it any time a sorcery couldn't have been cast, the controller of the permanent it becomes sacrifices it at the beginning of the next cleanup step.
Enchant creature

editions.flavor:
"Magic is my thread, my will the needle. I weave over you as if you never were."
—Poetics of Hanan

name: Mystic Visionary
text: Threshold — Mystic Visionary has flying as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.

editions.flavor: "The aven are heralds of divinity. The greatest glory is to join them in the sky."

name: Mystic Zealot
text: Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Mystic Zealot gets +1/+1 and has flying.

editions.flavor: Nomad youths aspire to one of two roles in the tribe: priest or warrior. Their secret dream is to become both.
Nomad youths aspire to one of two roles in the tribe: priest or warrior. Their secret dream is to become both.

name: Mystifying Maze
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{4}, {T}: Exile target attacking creature an opponent controls. At the beginning of the next end step, return it to the battlefield tapped under its owner's control.

name: Mythic Proportions
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +8/+8 and has trample.

editions.flavor: The blood of Krosa turns rational beings into primal forces.

name: Myth Realized
text:
Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, put a lore counter on Myth Realized.
{2}{W}: Put a lore counter on Myth Realized.
{W}: Until end of turn, Myth Realized becomes a Monk Avatar creature in addition to its other types and gains "This creature's power and toughness are each equal to the number of lore counters on it."

name: My Undead Horde Awakens
text:
(An ongoing scheme remains face up until it's abandoned.)
At the beginning of your end step, you may put target creature card from an opponent's graveyard onto the battlefield under your control.
When a creature put onto the battlefield with this scheme dies, abandon this scheme.

name: My Wish Is Your Command
text: When you set this scheme in motion, each opponent reveals his or her hand. You may choose a noncreature, nonland card revealed this way and cast it without paying its mana cost.

editions.flavor: "Indulge me. Just one spell. One potentially fatal spell gone horribly awry."

name: Naar Isle
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a flame counter on Naar Isle, then Naar Isle deals damage to you equal to the number of flame counters on it.
Whenever you roll {CHAOS}, Naar Isle deals 3 damage to target player.

text:
Vigilance

text: Protection from blue

text: Protection from artifacts

"Blades dull and armor dents. Marisi taught us that instinct is the only thing a true warrior needs."

name: Nacatl War-Pride
text:
Nacatl War-Pride must be blocked by exactly one creature if able.
Whenever Nacatl War-Pride attacks, create X tokens that are copies of Nacatl War-Pride and that are tapped and attacking, where X is the number of creatures defending player controls. Exile the tokens at the beginning of the next end step.

name: Nacre Talisman
text: Whenever a player casts a white spell, you may pay {3}. If you do, untap target permanent.

name: Nafs Asp
text: Whenever Nafs Asp deals damage to a player, that player loses 1 life at the beginning of his or her next draw step unless he or she pays {1} before that draw step.

text:
Bushido 1 (Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
Whenever Nagao, Bound by Honor attacks, Samurai creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.

name: Nagging Thoughts
text:
Look at the top two cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the other into your graveyard.
Madness {1}{U} (If you discard this card, discard it into exile. When you do, cast it for its madness cost or put it into your graveyard.)

name: Nahiri's Machinations
text:
At the beginning of combat on your turn, target creature you control gains indestructible until end of turn.
{1}{R}: Nahiri's Machinations deals 1 damage to target blocking creature.

editions.flavor: "Sorin, I'm going to take everything from you."

name: Nahiri's Wrath
text:
As an additional cost to cast Nahiri's Wrath, discard X cards.
Nahiri's Wrath deals damage equal to the total converted mana cost of the discarded cards to each of up to X target creatures and/or planeswalkers.

editions.flavor: "You brought this upon yourself, Sorin!"

name: Nahiri, the Harbinger
text:
+2: You may discard a card. If you do, draw a card.
−2: Exile target enchantment, tapped artifact, or tapped creature.
−8: Search your library for an artifact or creature card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library. It gains haste. Return it to your hand at the beginning of the next end step.

name: Nahiri, the Lithomancer
text:
+2: Create a 1/1 white Kor Soldier creature token. You may attach an Equipment you control to it.
−2: You may put an Equipment card from your hand or graveyard onto the battlefield.
−10: Create a colorless Equipment artifact token named Stoneforged Blade. It has indestructible, "Equipped creature gets +5/+5 and has double strike," and equip {0}.
Nahiri, the Lithomancer can be your commander.

name: Nakaya Shade
text: {B}: Nakaya Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn unless any player pays {2}.

editions.flavor: Made strong by reckless magic. Made horrid by reckless strife.

name: Naked Singularity
text:
Cumulative upkeep {3} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
If tapped for mana, Plains produce {R}, Islands produce {G}, Swamps produce {W}, Mountains produce {U}, and Forests produce {B} instead of any other type.

name: Nalathni Dragon
text:
Flying; banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
{R}: Nalathni Dragon gets +1/+0 until end of turn. If this ability has been activated four or more times this turn, sacrifice Nalathni Dragon at the beginning of the next end step.

editions.flavor:
These small but intelligent Dragons and their Olesian allies held back the tide of Pashalik Mons's hordes of Goblin Raiders.

name: Name Dropping
text: Gotcha Whenever an opponent says a word that's in the name of a card in your graveyard, you may say "Gotcha" If you do, return that card to your hand.

editions.flavor: Gemini (May 21–June 21) This week is a good time to branch out and meet others, but don't forget your roots. Avoid commitments and open flame.

name: Nameless Inversion
text:
Changeling (This card is every creature type.)
Target creature gets +3/-3 and loses all creature types until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Just as a changeling's influence can have dramatic effects, so too can its sudden withdrawal.
Just as a changeling's influence can have dramatic effects, so too can its sudden withdrawal.

text:
Nameless One's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Wizards on the battlefield.

name: Nameless Race
text:
Trample
As Nameless Race enters the battlefield, pay any amount of life. The amount you pay can't be more than the total number of white nontoken permanents your opponents control plus the total number of white cards in their graveyards.
Nameless Race's power and toughness are each equal to the life paid as it entered the battlefield.

text: When Nantuko Cultivator enters the battlefield, you may discard any number of land cards. Put that many +1/+1 counters on Nantuko Cultivator and draw that many cards.

text: {G}, {T}: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

name: Nantuko Husk

name: Nantuko Shade

text:
When Nantuko Shaman enters the battlefield, if you control no tapped lands, draw a card.

name: Nantuko Shrine
text: Whenever a player casts a spell, that player creates X 1/1 green Squirrel creature tokens, where X is the number of cards in all graveyards with the same name as that spell.

Flying

text:
Deathtouch
Revolt — Narnam Renegade enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it if a permanent you controlled left the battlefield this turn.

name: Narrow Escape
text: Return target permanent you control to its owner's hand. You gain 4 life.

—Arhana, Kazandu trapfinder

editions.flavor: He could find no strength left to budge, no power left to fight, no will left to live. Luckily, they could find him.

name: Narset, Enlightened Master
text:
First strike, hexproof
Whenever Narset, Enlightened Master attacks, exile the top four cards of your library. Until end of turn, you may cast noncreature cards exiled with Narset this turn without paying their mana costs.

name: Narset Transcendent
text:
+1: Look at the top card of your library. If it's a noncreature, nonland card, you may reveal it and put it into your hand.
−2: When you cast your next instant or sorcery spell from your hand this turn, it gains rebound.
−9: You get an emblem with "Your opponents can't cast noncreature spells."

text: First strike, protection from red

text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may have target opponent discard a card at random.
Whenever an opponent discards a card, you may create a 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature token.

editions.flavor: A savage hunter with a prince's bearing.
A savage hunter with a prince's bearing.

name: Nath's Buffoon
text: Protection from Elves

editions.flavor: Smik learned the elvish dance quickly enough. The most difficult, yet most important step was to stay out of Nath's sight until called to perform.

name: Nath's Elite
text:
All creatures able to block Nath's Elite do so.
When Nath's Elite enters the battlefield, clash with an opponent. If you win, put a +1/+1 counter on Nath's Elite. (Each clashing player reveals the top card of his or her library, then puts that card on the top or bottom. A player wins if his or her card had a higher converted mana cost.)

name: Natural Affinity
text: All lands become 2/2 creatures until end of turn. They're still lands.

editions.flavor: As long as the dryads are a part of the forest, the forest is a part of the army.
As long as the dryads are a part of the forest, the forest is a part of the army.

name: Natural Balance
text: Each player who controls six or more lands chooses five lands he or she controls and sacrifices the rest. Each player who controls four or fewer lands may search his or her library for up to X basic land cards and put them onto the battlefield, where X is five minus the number of lands he or she controls. Then each player who searched his or her library this way shuffles it.

name: Natural Connection
text: Search your library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.

editions.set: Duel Decks: Nissa vs. Ob Nixilis
editions.flavor: "Zendikar will not surrender, and neither can we."
"Zendikar will not surrender, and neither can we."

name: Natural Emergence
text:
When Natural Emergence enters the battlefield, return a red or green enchantment you control to its owner's hand.
Lands you control are 2/2 creatures with first strike. They're still lands.

name: Natural End
text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment. You gain 3 life.

editions.flavor: The haunted blade shattered, and the geist drifted gratefully to the Blessed Sleep.

name: Naturalize
text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

editions.flavor: The remains of ancient civilizations litter the run-down land.

"Well, it also makes a very nice flower pot. . . ."
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi machinist
If you want to destroy something lifeless, make it live.

"When your cities and trinkets crumble, only nature will remain."
—Garruk Wildspeaker

"When your cities and trinkets crumble, only nature will remain."
—Garruk Wildspeaker
The remains of ancient sky tyrants now feed the war-torn land.

"And if you threaten me again, your shiny steel trousers will be sprouting daggerthorn vines."
—Iveta, rooftop runner

"When your cities and trinkets crumble, only nature will remain."
—Garruk Wildspeaker
The idols of old are rich in minerals and magic. They are torn apart when nature aims to eat well.

"Nature does not need adornment."
—Garruk Wildspeaker
If you want to destroy something lifeless, make it live.
"From here, let the world be reborn."

"When your cities and trinkets crumble, only nature will remain."
—Garruk Wildspeaker

"One touch of nature makes the whole world kin."
—William Shakespeare,
Troilus and Cressida

"Stone and thought fade into ruin. Only the wind in the leaves will endure."
—Tomb inscription

"The scholars wept when we destroyed the hedron. I had no such pity. What would this world be like had we done so sooner?"
—The War Diaries

"Well, it also makes a very nice flower pot. . . ."
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi machinist

name: Natural Obsolescence
text: Put target artifact on the bottom of its owner's library.

editions.flavor:
"It is folly to believe your precious inventions will endure. All things return to the soil."
—Nirav, Tirahar elder

name: Natural Order
text:
As an additional cost to cast Natural Order, sacrifice a green creature.
Search your library for a green creature card and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor: . . . but the price of Mangara's freedom was Asmira's life.
. . . but the price of Mangara's freedom was Asmira's life.
...but the price of Mangaras's freedom was Asmira's life.

name: Natural Selection
text: Look at the top three cards of target player's library, then put them back in any order. You may have that player shuffle his or her library.

name: Natural Spring
text: Target player gains 8 life.

editions.flavor: The dying ask for water because they know it contains life.

"Jewels cannot be eaten nor gold drunk. What civilization trades, nature simply provides."
—Molimo, maro-sorcerer
Mirri listened intently, even as Hanna held the healing water to her lips. Would the sound of the spring drown out the elves' approach?
Though many have come to this place to wash their wounds, the water has never turned red.
The dying ask for water because they know it contains life.

name: Natural State
text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment with converted mana cost 3 or less.

editions.flavor:
"Killing the Eldrazi is not enough. We must erase all memory of them from this world."
—Greenweaver Mina

name: Natural Unity
text:
Hidden agenda (Start the game with this conspiracy face down in the command zone and secretly name a card. You may turn this conspiracy face up any time and reveal the chosen name.)
Creatures you control with the chosen name have "At the beginning of combat on your turn, you may pay {G}. If you do, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature."
